sentence.text: First of all , the hacker generally becomes a very proficient programmer , developing particular computer skills through constant practice and problem-solving .
with Frude 's assertion that one of the advantages of hackers is that they generally become very proficient programmers .
Some Night Goblins become very proficient Squig hunters and come to be quite nonchalant about the dangers involved .
Some deaf children are , however , very proficient at sign language and they can also spell out words using finger spelling .

If you have become fairly proficient at the nose-in hover , you may find that this figure is easier to perform by standing with your back to the wind and taking off and landing in the nose-in position .
But I was struck by just how proficient at handling babies and young children were people from all walks of life .
She felt herself to be reasonably proficient in Italian and she had begun , rather to the disapproval of her employers , to learn a few words of the Neapolitan dialect .
As the spring came Dr Fytiaras became more proficient in English .
By the time he left the Old Kent Road school , he had absorbed the classics , learnt French , and was proficient in mathematics and in the sciences which were attainable only by university students .
It is known that he was proficient in the sciences of the time , as well as being a considerable linguist .
He wrote on the physiology of the inner ear , was proficient in Japanese , and an expert in systems of knitting .
A youth aged twelve-fourteen could work a frame with three months experience and could become proficient within six months .
At first glance this may seem a tedious and unnecessary task , for any nurse aspiring to teach others ought to be sufficiently proficient at nursing not to require this kind of reminder .

Close your eyes and practice thinking it over and over again in your mind until you become proficient at blocking out all other thoughts and ideas , and can achieve a level of deep calm and relaxation .

This is a broad , vocationally-biased course which is designed to develop problem-solving skills , to give students a knowledge of relevant mathematical and statistical models , and to make them proficient users of appropriate computer software .
Young readers taught by an approach that stresses decoding ( accurate word-for-word reproduction of what is on the page ) may fail to become proficient readers .
Hugh Capet executed the most proficient sacking of pernay during the harvest of 947 , when he set alight the entire region and carried off all of its wine .
He became an amazingly proficient speed speechreader .
Later , as the student becomes more proficient , she will provide her own feedback and the teacher may delay or withhold comments .
Gradually as the person becomes more proficient , background noises and stimulation fade from attention , leaving the subject conscious and alert , but relaxed and calm .
Through the provision of proficient BSL interpreters in employment , further education and in law , an enormous range of choice is offered to deaf people .
